info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 7:50PM EDT until April 2 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS Gaylord MI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan...
Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County.
For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 4.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EDT Sunday was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 03/30/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Monday morning, sooner if needed.Monday morning at 800 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
